result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #16CM352.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on November 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner requests a jury status and jury trial date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Anthony J Lomas did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner states Defendant is running late (from Madison) and is requesting an adjournment as he still has not received a global offer from the state.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
to appear filed by Attorney Cameron Weitzner

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Anthony J Lomas did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner requests an adjournment for plea and sentence.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Weitzner requests another further proceeding date as he has not been appointed on the Defendant's latest case (16CM352). Court sets.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with attorney Amber Rumpf for Attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rumpf requests another date to negotiate cases with the State. Court sets.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Huber bailee status.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant to seek counsel.  Defendant allowed to have 2 non-collect phone calls to obtain bail.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY THE COURT. Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.
